greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of solutions to x^2 + y^2 + 2*z^2 = n in positive integers x,y,z.
reference: Mohammad K. Azarian, Diophantine Pair, Problem B-881, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 37, No. 3, August 1999, pp. 277-278.  Solution published in Vol. 38, No. 2, May 2000, pp. 183-184.
formula: G.f.: T(x)^2 * T(x^2) where T(x) = sum(k>=1, x^(k^2)). [_Joerg Arndt_, Oct 01 2012]
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 29 2012
